answers.answer: I had a lot of fluid, my little one was able to keep flipping breech to vertex till the end.  I was induced overdue and he came out just fine.  His head didn't settle in all the way though, but once my water broke, he came right down.  You should be fine, just a little bigger than you would've been, but enjoy the belly, won't be long now, congrats!

Would you please tell me what week you induced, and how many lbs your baby? I had U/S yesterday stated that I have extra omiotic fluid, and will have AFI next Wednesday. Do you think extra amiotic fluid is normal?
Have you had a 3-D u/s?  That can show abnormalities and ease your mind when the baby looks fine.

Hi,Guys, how's everyone out there? This site is really great.I want you guys to help me with this problem of mine,with those guys that knew about my case, I have gotten the name of the problem, it (POLYCYSTIC OVARIAN SYNDROME) how can you be of help? how do i solve this problem? I live and work in China where I'm having problems of communicating.Whatever you think, please dont esitate to bail me out of this problem of mine as i really need a child now. thank you all, and love from my family.

There is a drug, Glucaphage, that controls diabetes but has shown to help in polycystic ovarian disease.  i had a friend that has PCOS and took Glucaphage and was pregnant within a month of meds.  Prior to that she had been trying for over a year.  Good luck!
hi,Thank you soo much XRAYU, im really greatful.

My Dr. had me wait till I was a little over a week overdue and my little one was 10 lbs. 3 oz. and 22 1/4 inches long.  He was a big boy and still managed to flip around.  They figured he was at least 8 lbs. when they did the external aversion, so they were surprised he even turned at all (after the fact), but then he flipped breech and back again in the following weeks.  By 39 weeks he did settle vertex, so I barely dodged that C-Section.  I have no idea how excessive my fluid was though, my Dr. just warned me that I had a lot and that was why my baby was able to keep turning and warned me that after he was in place he may not drop because of it.  He did float for awhile but cooperated at the end and I was able to be induced just fine.  We all figured I was huge because of the fluid, at the end you could feel parts of my baby, but there were times you couldn't feel any, he tucked so far back.  I once told my Dr. it hurt alot and I thought he was big, but she told me that big babies can turn and be as active as mine was, they predicted 7 1/2 to 8 lbs. at birth, really uncomfortable for me and I was way too big.  Hopefully your little one will cooperate too, good luck, and I really hope I didn't scare you with his size, we were just fine!

question: I would like to know your Extra Amiotic Fluid Success Stories; I am 38 weeks.  Thanks.  I personally thanks to Andi's story.
title: Please share your Extra Amiotic Fluid Success Stories
